- Bonus points if the feature is not only submitted / PR'd to SSX but used in an application featuring other bounties.

challenges.name: Risk Management
challenges.description:
Risk management and mitigation are of paramount importance in any development product, and are existential to the blockchain domain. In the last few years, the industry has witnessed a myriad of security breaches and abusive use cases - this has to stop!

The composability of DeFi enables the BNB dApps to connect with the rest of the ecosystem; however, it also exposes the whole ecosystem as well as its users to various risks. At least three different aspects of risk are important to assessing whether an asset exposes the BNB Chain to undue risk: smart contract risk, counter-party risk, and market risk.

To address smart contract risk, over the last year, BNB Chain has introduced AvengerDAO security initiative to protect users from financial losses and deter malicious actors and applications, and it has been a huge success. Through partnerships with the leading industry security organizations, we've managed to considerably reduce the number of misdeeds on the BNB Smart Chain.

During this year we want to address the counter-party and market risks. As part of the challenge you‚Äôre to design an implement either one of them as a framework exposing API to the potential users. You can use any methodology as long as it has academical backing with references to the research papers. As bonus points you can add some sort of user interface to visualize the results.

Please see more details to what counter-party and market risks are.
Counter-party risk assesses qualitatively how and by who the asset is governed. There are different degrees of governance decentralization that may give direct control over funds (e.g., as backing) or attack vectors to the governance architecture, which could expose control and funds. Counterparty risk is determined by the level of centralisation, which is measured by the number of parties that control a token‚Äôs protocol, as well as the number of holders and the level of trust in the entity, project, community or processes.

Market risks are linked to the size of a particular asset pool in the protocol, as well as fluctuations in both supply and demand. The markets need to hold sufficient volume to account for any liquidations in the particular pool (i.e., sell offs which tend to lower the price of the underlying asset through slippage affecting the value recovered). Market risk assessments usually involve assessment of the volatility and the liquidity of the assets, but additional extensions are welcome.
challenges.acceptanceCriteria:
• Design and implement a framework that exposes an API for either counter-party or market risks on the BNB Smart Chain.

  • The framework can have academic backing with references to research papers.

  • The methodology used should be able to assess the risks effectively and provide actionable insights.

  • Bonus points will be given for including a user interface to visualize the results.

  • The implementation should be secure and reliable, with a focus on risk management and mitigation.

  • The solution should address the risk factors specific to the BNB Smart Chain ecosystem.

  • The code should be well-documented, easy to understand, and open-sourced.

  • The submission should include a demonstration video/tutorial of the framework's usage.

challenges.name: Spectral.finance's Bounty
challenges.description:
It‚Äôs Buidl season with Spectral Finance!

We‚Äôre excited to welcome Web2 + Web3 developers alike, to our growing ecosystem through #BuidlWeek at ETHDenver.

Prompt: Build a dApp that integrates Spectral‚Äôs MACRO score in a way that brings value to an existing Web3 protocol, or that can create new value through a novel implementation (ex. hybrid lending systems, identity tools for MACRO Score, etc.).

Launch MVP on Abritrum Goerli. We‚Äôre looking for innovative solutions that encourage collaboration. Such as tools to bridge the gap between, traditional FinTech and Web3, credit analysis; projects that utilize the MACRO Score to enable end-to-end capital efficiency or that enables new ways of lending on-chain.

Examples include (*but are not limited to*):

1. A lending protocol that uses Spectral‚Äôs MACRO Score (on-chain credit score) to 1. adjust interest/collateral rates 2. OR create an entirely new model for lending (eg. imagine Uniswap v3 but for lenders)

2. A gating mechanism for protocol usage. Gates can be ranges of the score (eg. imagine a low-risk lending facility only serving users with scores 700-850)

3. A protocol that does not reveal a user‚Äôs score on-chain (using zero-knowledge proofs or other tools) and adjusts behavior with users in an obfuscated manner. (eg. User A interacts with Protocol 1 ‚Üí Protocol 1 wants to know how credible User A is. How do we prove to Protocol 1 what User A‚Äôs score is without revealing the score to Protocol 1.)
challenges.acceptanceCriteria:
- Vision and use case

- Live and usable MVP on Abritrum Goerli

- Video demo of a live application

- Open Source code: e.g. MIT, BSD, GNU

- Great documentation in code and a well-explained **README**.

- Please show a **steady commit trail** and thought process e.g. sketches, discussion, and issues on how you arrived at the decision to incorporate this feature.

- List any **challenges or benefits** you encountered in the developer experience.

- Overall Value Proposition (any of the following):

- Improves capital efficiency of lenders and borrowers in DeFi protocols.

- Improves the functionality of Web3 protocols.

- Implementation of MACRO score in an application creates value in novel ways.

- Creation of a tool that improves the MACRO Score. - User Experience - Creativity

challenges.name: Build on RISC Zero or Integrate RISC Zero into your project
challenges.description:
We are offering a total of 5 prizes, with a top prize of 7,000 USDC and a minimum prize of 2,000 USDC to qualifying projects.

We reserve the right to withhold prizing in cases where low-quality submissions do not meet our bounty requirements.

RISC Zero‚Äôs core technology is our RISC-V Zero Knowledge Virtual Machine (https://github.com/risc0/risc0). On top of that, we‚Äôre building a zero knowledge computing platform called Bonsai. Bonsai supports the ability to do arbitrarily complex computations in plain Rust and access proofs of those computations on-chain, effectively adding Rust support and Zero Knowledge scaling to Layer 1 Ethereum.

Bonsai is currently in a pre-release stage and, as part of this bounty, we‚Äôd like you to build an application using Bonsai. Doing so requires getting early access, which you can request here. However, even prior to getting access, you can participate in this bounty.

To build such an application, you‚Äôll need two major components: your application logic written in the form of zkVM guest code and a solidity contract as an interface to the Ethereum world. Communication between those two components will happen via the Ethereum Bonsai bridge.

Because Bonsai is in a pre-release state, we expect you to need some help getting going - to support this, we‚Äôll have Bonsai developers available to help via discord (and a few in person, as well).

For application ideas, think about computationally intensive tasks. What have you always wanted to see on Ethereum but development complexity or gas costs/caps have kept you from building?
challenges.acceptanceCriteria: We‚Äôll be looking for projects that demonstrate why a generic zero knowledge compute platform is so interesting. This means that porting an existing Solidity application to Bonsai is probably not a good strategy. We will be judging submissions based on utility, novelty, and quality. Partially finished submissions will be considered for awards.

challenges.name: Scroll ‚ô• Lens | Cross-chain Decentralized Social Media

What's better than open social graphs? Cross-chain composable social graphs! For this bounty, we're looking for advancements in the L2 and cross-chain experience of Lens and decentralized social. This could be through prototypes, open-source infrastructure, protocol designs, and more. We want to see how you imagine working with Lens in a multichain world, especially with the low gas costs and fast finality of Scroll's zk-rollup.

Two winners chosen for 1500$ in USDC each
challenges.acceptanceCriteria:
Propose, prototype or deploy a project that explore decentralized social on Scroll

Judging will prioritize reusable, open-source projects that build on the existing Lens ecosystem.

Nice to haves: A. understanding the value zk-rollups bring for fast finality and messaging, B. a working prototype!

List any challenges or benefits you encountered in the design or developer experience.

challenges.name: BUIDL on Fireblocks
challenges.description:
Build your project by getting early access to the Fireblocks Developer Sandbox. Fireblocks is offering free, secure MPC-based wallets that work with popular Testnets. Use the Fireblocks API and SDKs to create wallets at scale, deploy smart contracts, interact cross-chain, and build the most possible use cases you can think of. The Fireblocks digital asset infrastructure is used by small startups and large enterprises in web3, crypto trading, payments and more. It‚Äôs the infrastructure that grows and scales with you, making blockchain oriented development easy and secure.


Almost any project can add Fireblocks as part of their stack in EthDenver!


What can you build using Fireblocks?

  • Anything that requires wallets to operate

  • Custody wallets for your users, or generate one-time deposit addresses

  • Fireblocks wallets support multiple protocols and chains - you can run a cross chain operation in one platform

  • Deploy smart contracts

  • Interact with contracts from your backend

  • Signing off-chain messages

  • Signing, broadcasting, and following the execution of transactions

  • Financial and non financials tools

  • Minting NFTs or fungible tokens (ERC-20, ERC-721, ERC-1155)

  • Develop in any language using our SDKs and API

1st prize - 10K

2nd prize - 5K

3nd prize - 2.5K

Special recognition (2.5K):

  • Web3, NFT and GameFi track

  • Fintech, DeFi, Security and Cross chain track

  • Next billion users, ‚Äúwalletless‚Äù experience for end users
challenges.acceptanceCriteria:
• Sign up for the Fireblocks Developer Sandbox (https://info.fireblocks.com/ethdenver-sandbox)

  • Ensure your project utilizes Fireblocks wallets in some way, using the Fireblocks APIs or SDKs

  • Judging will be based on the most innovative use cases that rely on the Fireblocks Developer Sandbox and Fireblocks API. Be creative! We‚Äôd love to see a working MVP.

  • Show your work! We‚Äôd love to see your thought process, architecture notes, design considerations or issue resolutions you had to make for your project

  • Please list out challenges you faced using the Developer Sandbox, API or SDKs, as well as how you tackled them

  • Bonus points for:

    • Providing valuable feedback that helps us improve the developer experience

challenges.name: Connect the world with Chainlink
challenges.description:
Number of Bounties: 5

Build something awesome using Chainlink! Anything that came from the Chainlink Documentation counts, using Price Feeds, VRF, or Automation Chainlink Automation enables conditional execution of your smart contracts functions. Define the business rules, the trigger and what will happen. Chainlink VRF is the verifiable, tamper-proof random number generator for blockchain gaming and NFT projects. Any smart contract can get random values without compromising security or usability. Chainlink Proof of Reserve Feeds provides the status of the reserves for several assets in the same way as Price Feeds. Chainlink NFT Floor Pricing Feeds provides a conservative and risk averse floor price estimate for an NFT collection. Chainlink Data Feeds are the quickest way to connect your smart contracts to the real-world data such as asset prices, reserve balances, and L2 sequencer health.
challenges.acceptanceCriteria:
Criteria

To be eligible, the project should make use of Chainlink to make a state change on the blockchain to be eligible. It can be any Chainlink services, except Chainlink Functions, which has his own bounty. If you would like to use both, you can submit to both tracks, but the judges will choose different projects, so if you are the best in one Chainlink bounty, will not be awarded in the other. Nice to have: how you use Chainlink in the project description. It must be possible for the judges to find the Chainlink use in your code. Only the intention to use is not valid. You must present your project for the Chainlink judges! Projects whose team does not present will not be evaluated. We will look at the following criteria: - UI/UX/DX - How useful is your application? Is it visually appealing? - Blockchain technology application - How valuable this project is for decentralization and adoption of Blockchain and Web3 - Wow Factor - Anything not covered above! This is if you blow us away in some other way.

Resources

You can get started with any resources by checking out the hackathon resources page. You‚Äôll find: Smart Contract Starter Tutorial Documentation for all the Chainlink features Best practices utilized by top protocols like Aave and Synthetix Hardhat Starter Kits Brownie Starter Kits Truffle Starter Kits dApp Tools Starter Kit And unlimited demos. There are plenty of video resources on that page for step-by-step working and building with: NFTs DeFi DAOs Gaming And more! "

challenges.name: Unlock opportunities with Cross-Chain Transfer Protocol
challenges.description: Cross-Chain Transfer Protocol (CCTP) is a permissionless on-chain utility that can burn native USDC on a source chain, and mint native USDC of the same amount on a destination chain. Developers can embed CCTP into their apps and provide users with the most capital efficient way to transfer USDC across chains ‚Äì unifying liquidity across the ecosystem and simplifying user experience. Here are some cool use cases where we've seen developers using CCTP: Cross-chain swaps, Cross-chain deposits and Purchase NFTs across chains. What else can you do with it?
challenges.acceptanceCriteria: We want projects that are full MVPs that include code and not just a proof of concept in a powerpoint. These should be functional and able show the functionality in action Please show us how you got to the solution. This may include gists, sketches, discussion, issues, etc. We would like to see a steady commit trail of your development process, and not just one big pull request. List any challenges you‚Äôve had while integrating with the protocol and using our API and our docs.

challenges.name: Build on Pocket Network
challenges.description: This task is designed to incentivize using decentralized architecture in your projects. Pocket Network provides the only reliable and decentralized RPC network in the world governed by a DAO with the most contributor-friendly ecosystem. Pocket offers free connections to dozens of chains, from Ethereum and Polygon to Fantom and FUSE.
challenges.acceptanceCriteria:
‚óè Decentralize your RPC for any project using a Pocket endpoint
‚óè Endpoints must be private and minted by application developers (no public RPC usage)


We reserve the right to withhold prizing in cases where low-quality submissions do not meet our bounty requirements.

challenges.name: Build on Base üîµ
challenges.description:
Build a dApp on Base testnet or tooling that benefits the Base ecosystem.

Don‚Äôt know what to build? Here‚Äôs some ideas:

  • Gaming: A web3-capable video game, built on Base (Testnet).

    • For example: A web-based Unity game with the ability to connect a wallet and read on-chain NFT data, using thirdweb and Coinbase Cloud‚Äôs GamingKit (https://thirdweb.com/solutions/gaming).

  • UX: A dApp with intuitive and seamless UX, built on Base (Testnet).

    • For example: A dApp with account abstraction and gasless transactions, using Gelato‚Äôs SDK (https://www.gelato.network/).

  • DAOs / Community: A dApp for managing governance or web3 communities, built on Base (Testnet)

Looking for Base testnet ETH? Go grab some on the Base Goerli testnet faucet (linked below).

We recommend Base development with Coinbase Wallet Extension (see resources), which fully supports the Base Goerli network. 


Note: These are just ideas! Your project does not have to fall under any of the categories above to be eligible to win. See the official eligibility and judging criteria below.
challenges.acceptanceCriteria:
Eligibility Criteria

Deploy at least one smart contract on the Base testnet to qualify. To be eligible, you must also link to your smart contract.


Exception: If you are building a developer tooling/infrastructure and not deploying a smart contract, you must specify and demonstrate how your tool benefits the Base ecosystem, and/or makes it easier to build on Base.

Judging Criteria

Projects will be judged based on the following criteria:

  • Creativity

  • Innovation

  • Technical complexity

  • Positive impact to the Base ecosystem

challenges.name: Create an AttestationStation Visualization
challenges.description:
Create a visualization that shows the emergent connections possible in the AttestationStation. Examples can include showing how attestations have changed over time, a tool for showing analytics from live attestations, and network maps.

All qualified submissions to this bounty will receive an exclusive AttestationStation NFT after the hackathon ends (one for each team member).

The 3 best submissions will receive 1000$ in USDC!
challenges.acceptanceCriteria:
Design Criteria:

- A tool for visualizing a specific set of attestations and showing how those attestations have changed and grown over time.

- This can include network maps, analytics derived from attestations, or other visualizations that are interesting, informative, or actionable.

Submission Criteria:

- Submission must use data from the AttestationStation on Optimism Mainnet in some way.

- Provide a link to your visualization, along with source code or query for how you made it.

- Experience matters. Provide a link to your visualization or tool that does not require technical implementation by the viewer.

- Show your work. Provide the source code, query, or explainer for how you made it. This can include a github repo, Dune analytics dash, or Medium post.

- Three winners will be chosen based on usability, clarity, and insightfulness.

challenges.name: Build a MetaMask snap using the Truffle Snaps Box
challenges.description: Truffle boxes provide boilerplate code to get your projects started as quickly as possible. In this bounty, we want you to use our latest Truffle Snaps Box to build a MetaMask Snap that interacts with a smart contract deployed and tested with Truffle.

challenges.name: (Under Review) Create an AttestationStation App
challenges.description:
The goal of this bounty is to create an app that creates new attestations, uses existing attestations, or both as part of the user experience. Examples include event ticketing, webforms, a SybilRank calculator, or a composable allowlist for NFTs.

The AttestationStation is a neutral, simple platform for addresses to make attestations about one another. Attestations are an extremely powerful tool that can be used to establish relationships between different addresses.


Additional prizes: 2nd place winner: $2718, 2x 3rd place winners: $1167, Bonus for winning submissions, additional $400

Bonuses!

- All qualified submissions to this bounty will receive an exclusive
AttestationStation NFT after the hackathon ends (one for each team member).

- All prize-winning submissions to this category who deploy their smart contracts with ChugSplash will receive a bonus $444.4 (Up to 4)
challenges.acceptanceCriteria:
Design requirements:

- The goal of this bounty is to create an app that either creates new attestations, uses existing attestations, or both! As more and more users and applications push data into the AttestationStation it‚Äôll become possible to figure out more and more complex relationships.

- We‚Äôre looking for apps that are exciting, fun, novel, or clever. The ideal entry unlocks new ways for users to experience reputation and identity, in particular by adding to the attestation graph and seeing its emerging complexity. It could also be a dead-simple use case, such as an online event ticket.

- Your app should target end users in some way ‚Äì not just developers ‚Äì and use attestations to improve their experience. Because of this, judges care about user experience, clear messaging for users, and design.

Submission requirements:

- Projects must be deployed on Optimism Goerli or Optimism Mainnet, must be open source, and smart contracts must be verified

- Post a short video, Twitter thread, or Medium post explaining what you‚Äôre doing. This can make use of your 3-5-minute demonstration video.

challenges.name: Test locally with zero-config forking using Infura's free archive node access
challenges.description: Thanks to Infura's free archive node access, you can fork mainnet locally with zero configuration using Truffle's local test chain, Ganache. It's as easy as 'ganache -fork mainnet'! You can also impersonate accounts, auto-mine blocks, and use Ganache programmatically with Node.js. Ganache allows you to customize a local blockchain for quick testing and mimicking production environments In this bounty, we want to see how you use Ganache to test your dapps!
challenges.acceptanceCriteria:

In this bounty, we want to see you build a dapp that is deployed using Infura and Truffle Dashboard.

challenges.name: OpenZeppelin Defender Integration
challenges.description: Integrate OpenZeppelin Defender into your ETHDenver project using at least one platform feature that is highlighted in your project presentation. Defender platform features include Admin for contract management, Autotasks for automation, Relayers for transaction delivery and Sentinels for monitoring and alerts. You can get started using a variety of pre-built Defender serverless templates for each track category or build your own from scratch.
challenges.acceptanceCriteria: Sign-up for a free-tier Defender account and utilize one or more of the platform features in your ETHDenver project. Defender platform features include Admin for contract management, Autotasks for automation, Relayers for transaction delivery and Sentinels for monitoring and alerts. Your use of Defender should be featured in your project presentation and some reference should be included in your project source code.

challenges.name: OKX- Automatic discovery of defi project detectors
challenges.description:
New projects are deployed on chain every day, most of which are imitations of existing projects, and a few are new innovative projects.

The ability to quickly collect and display the information on the chain of projects is a common demand of a DeFi Farmer.

We hope to build a more powerful and fast detector to help us find and classify existing projects automatically, including imitation and innovation projects.

Similar to forks from defillama, but not 100% the same, we hope that the model can be more universal, rather than finding a lot of boring imitations of existing projects.

Resources - Link to README - Link to GitHub - Links to Docs - Links to Tutorials and Guides - Links to Walkthrough Videos "
challenges.acceptanceCriteria:
Judging will lean towards projects that have a better detector of good investment opportunities. We hope that the items found by these detectors can be connected to our WEB3-Yield products. But in any case, we will be interested if your strategies can find a series of projects & the accuracy of the corresponding project address can reach a usable standard.

- Integrate one of OKX Web3 products to your project: OKX Non-custodial wallet, Dex, Yeild or NFT marketplace

- Build something super dope and if we think it's awesome, we'll throw you in our grant program and/or accelerator.

- Please show a steady commit trail and thought process e.g. sketches, discussion, issues on how you arrived at the decision to incorporate this feature.

- List any challenges or benefits you encountered in the developer experience. -

Requirements:

- A detailed description document of your detector's strategies - An operational MVP

- The model should be universal, and the number of Dapp projects that can be identified should exceed 200

- At least 20 detected Dapp detailed data (including but not limited to Dapp smart contract address, creator address, address characteristics, service charge capital source) and data indicators you think are useful (including but not limited to APY, 24h address interaction number, etc.)

- Detailed data of some detected projects and data indicators that you think are useful

Nice to haves:

- Evaluation report on the accuracy of the project and the project address - Detect the value of the project to users: who will pay attention to the project you find?

challenges.description: Build an escrow system for collecting payroll payments on the NEAR mainnet.
challenges.acceptanceCriteria: Criteria *To qualify for the bounty, the submission will need to include: A smart contract that matches the functionality of the current OpolisPay contract (found here: https://github.com/opolis/crypto-payroll-contracts) A version of the Opolis Subgraph (found here: https://github.com/opolis/opolis-subgraph) A simple front-end that should take parameters such as a payrollID and USD amount and allow someone to pay in a chosen token after connecting a Near wallet (example of front-end: https://www.loom.com/share/08b17c33d5124d08be26f23e3889722a)

challenges.name: Open bounty for the most-innovative use of CoW Swap and/or CoW Protocol
challenges.description:
Number of Bounties:

This bounty will be distributed according to the amount and quality of submissions.

Today, CoW Protocol is mainly used by traders leveraging the CoW Swap frontend. Our target audience for CoW Swap is retail users that need a simple UI and want to avoid various blockchain complexities. But anyone can build a UI on top of CoW Protocol that is tailored to a different user profile (e.g. pro traders, smart contracts, exotic custom order-makers looking for TWAP, limit orders, etc.) ‚Äî and these are all highly-desirable. We will award $2500-5000 (depending on the response to the first bounty) to be shared amongst the teams that build and deploy the most-creative frontend on top of CoW Protocol.
challenges.acceptanceCriteria: Submit a working demo (making a swap on a testnet) with the corresponding github repo to check all the relevant code parts.

challenges.name: Cypher Wallet Push SDK
challenges.description:
CypherD Wallet Push SDK is a capability that 3rd party developers can use to push dApp events to wallet addresses by just listening to an event on smart contract and converting it into an human readable iOS/Android Push Notification.

For example, if a user gets a bid on their NFT on OpenSea, you can use Cypher Wallet Push SDK to notify the user based on the wallet address via delivering the push notification to their installed Cypher Wallet App. Cypher Wallet App needs to be installed at least in read-only mode without seed phrase.
challenges.acceptanceCriteria: Use Cypher Wallet Push SDK to create a push notification for any of the existing dApp use-cases or for a new dApp that you are building.

challenges.name: Port over Ethereum dApps to Neon-EVM
challenges.description:
Neon EVM is a solution for anyone looking to scale Ethereum dApps on Solana in a developer-friendly manner and tap into Solana's vibrant ecosystem.

We offer participants of ETHDenver to deploy their Ethereum dApps on Neon EVM and make test transactions.

The expected results: a working smart contract (unit-tests results are crucial), UI (very desirable).

If you don't have time to create your application at ETHDenver, then you can migrate the existing Ethereum dApps to Neon-EVM (there's no need to develop any smart contract).

You can refer to dApps from the following list:

https://dappradar.com/rankings/protocol/ethereum

and ask the mentors from Neon Labs.
challenges.acceptanceCriteria:
Each project will be ranked by our judges on the following 5 factors:

Technicality

Originality

Usability (UI/UX/UD)

Practicality

WOW factor

challenges.name: CoW Swap's ERC1271 for DAOs (Buidl better tools for DAOs to manage or automate their treasury management)
challenges.description:
Number of Bounties:

This bounty will be distributed according to the amount and quality of submissions.

CoW Protocol is the only trading protocol designed with DAOs in mind. This is why it's the best way for DAOs to engage with it, since the world of possibilities that it has to offer is endless. Since ETH Denver is THEE conference of DAOs, we thought it was right to focus on enabling DAOs to go to their next level. With ERC-1271 integration into CoW Protocol, DAOs, smart contracts and the combination of both, are now able to sign messages as if they were EOAs (Externally Owned Accounts, like MetaMask). On CoW Swap, EOA users never pay for failed transactions because they sign messages to place their orders ‚Äî but smart contracts don‚Äôt get these same benefits, since (before ERC-1271) they must place their order with an on-chain transaction (by calling the preSignature method). While this might have been a stopper in the past, using ERC1271 allows anyone to build any sort of tools that eases the management of DAO treasuries, their trading strategies, or even their buyback programs. We will award $7500 to the team that builds the most-creative demo of ERC-1271 automation tools for DAOs to be able to place orders on CoW Protocol ‚Äì i.e. stop losses, Time Weighted Average Price (TWAP) orders, Good After Time (GAT) orders, etc. Attach a front end to the product and earn an extra $2500!
challenges.acceptanceCriteria: Submit a working demo (making a swap on a testnet) with the corresponding github repo to check all the relevant code parts.

challenges.name: Promoted Posts Banner Widget
challenges.description: Create a banner that displays three posts in compressed form that we can place on the top page. Post authors need to bid NEAR to get their posts ""promoted"", and the three posts with the highest bids should be displayed.
challenges.acceptanceCriteria: Three posts with the current highest bid are displayed at the top of the page. There should also be a small button/link (‚ÄúShow All Promoted‚Äù) that shows all posts that were promoted. Users should be able to set intervals for each bid to spread the funds evenly, i.e. a bid of 100 NEAR over 10 days has the same power as a bid of 10 NEAR for 1 day if their schedules overlap, or to designate specific amounts for certain days over the time frame. Bids of equal costs should be randomly displayed. Proceeds should be immediately transferred to a hardcoded NEAR account (you will have to transfer ownership over it to DevGov DAO to receive the bounty). Quality of UI design and UX are the major factors in determining whether to grant this bounty. Please create them as separate widgets that we can later embed into https://devgovgigs.near.social/.

challenges.name: Open Aurora Bounty
challenges.description: Please build anything (yes, anything) using Aurora. It's that simple. To get the ball rolling and give you a sense of what can be built on Aurora (pretty much anything), we shortlisted some ideas that we‚Äôd love to see you working on: Smart Contracts Security - Can you make smart contracts smarter? More secure? Can you integrate ML/AI to automate and improve audits? Marketplaces - Public goods are hard to fund? Can you think how on-chain multisided platforms can facilitate how to fund hard-to-quantify public goods like scientific papers, music, poetry, etc? Flash Loans - Can you implement a decentralized flash loans platform in Aurora? How would handle arbitrage? Would you be able to deploy your own arbitrage bots or use existing ones? Would you be able to get opportunities for DEXs deploying in Aurora. Gasless Transactions and Meta-transactions - Gasless transactions can be critical in many areas like video games where many small transactions are constantly needed. Can you think of ways of processing transactions batches that can be cleared with minimum user interaction? Can you develop a wallet that would make gasless transactions possible? NFTs + AI - Can you think innovative use cases for the integration of chatGPT, Stable Diffusion, DALL-E with NFTs? Can you create collections of NFT that evolve from previous collections from the same author? Can you address existing concerns about IP and stable diffusion? Criteria Resources
challenges.acceptanceCriteria: The judges will use the following criteria to evaluate all submissions. Innovation: we will look at the originality and creativity of the submission, and how it solves a problem in a unique way. User Experience: The design, usability, and overall user experience of the solution will be considered, we want to see creative solutions that are accessible to all types of users. Completeness: The closest an application is ready to be deployed to mainnet the better, so, is your application ready to go to public beta? Is the front-end usable to onboard users right away? Viability and Business Potential: Judges will consider the viability of the solution in the real world, including its scalability, sustainability and its potential to generate revenue. Technical Difficulty: Judges will evaluate the level of technical difficulty involved in creating the solution and the skill level demonstrated by the team. Code Quality: The quality, reusability and maintainability of the code will be considered too, including the use of best practices and adherence to coding standards.

  • Please comply with all instructions from ETHDenver organizers

  • Be cool - disruptive behavior will not be tolerated and may result in disqualification

  • Please refer to the waiver you signed when applying for the event for additional details regarding appropriate behavior.

  • Decisions are final for determining prizes and awards by the #BUIDL Steward and/or #BUIDLx Team

    The #BUIDL Steward is like the commissioner of any sports league. The #BUIDL Steward will hav final say in your team and projects eligibility in #BUIDLathon, prizes, and awards for all track prizes and sponsor bounties.

challenges.name: Enable Huma with a new payment network or payroll provider
challenges.description:
Huma launched the first on-chain factoring solution with Request Network and Superfluid so that the invoice or streamed payment receivers get paid now instead of waiting for a long time. This enables people and businesses to access their future income whenever they need. 

Integrate with an on-chain or off-chain payment network or a payroll provider to enable Huma‚Äôs factoring capability for these platforms. 
 
A typical demo should demonstrate at least 2 of the following functions : 
1.  Tokenization of future payment 
2.  Extension of Huma ReceivableFactoringPool contract to suit your needs
3.  A decision module on eligibility of payments for factoring (Huma Evaluation Agent preferred, other solutions acceptable if Python is not your thing)
4.  An end-user experience

-   WE COMMIT TO PROVIDE THE BEST DEVELOPER SUPPORT!
challenges.acceptanceCriteria:
-   Prototype that demonstrates the end-to-end flow. 
-   Tokenize the payment stream and have a decent design for credit risk management. 
-   Use Huma protocol

We reserve the right to withhold in cases where low-quality submissions do not meet our bounty requirements.

challenges.name: Build new signal adapters
challenges.description:
Huma Decentralized Signal Portfolio is an open platform that enables access to high-quality signals about a borrower's income, assets, liabilities, and creditworthiness. These signals are collected through Signal Adapters hosted on the DSP, which can access data from a variety of on-chain and off-chain sources. Any developer can contribute to the platform by adding a new Signal Adapter for a specific data source. By adding and improving these signals, one improves the quality of underwriting across the ecosystem.

The winning teams should create new Signal Adapters that can retrieve useful data that can improve the quality of the underwriting.

Below are some sample ideas. You can definitely go beyond this list: 

On-chain Signals

  • Wallet Transactions

  • Online Payments (RequestNetwork, Coinshift, UtopiaLabs, Sablier, etc)

  • Payroll/DAO

  • NFT Royalty

  • Staking Income (solo, or pooled)

  • Yield Farming

  • Trading

  • DID and Credentials

  • Off-chain

    • Off-chain Payment API integration (Plaid, Stripe, Bill.com, Recurly, etc)

    • Real-world assets (Real estate MLS record, etc)


Not a engineer but a data wizard? No problem! We have a special rewards for the teams that submit best research paper on how can we use data to determine a wallet‚Äôs credit worthiness, or identify suspicious transactions.
challenges.acceptanceCriteria:
• (for Signal Adapter) Prototype that works

  • (for Research Paper) Reproducible data analysis, shows impactful insight 

  • Technical soundness of the adapter 

  • Conforming to Huma DSP/EA standards

  • Potential impact of the adapter

We reserve the right to withhold in cases where low-quality submissions do not meet our bounty requirements.

challenges.name: A credit line for every wallet
challenges.description:
Today, each wallet functions as a debit card. We envision a credit line for every wallet so that people can borrow or spend as needed, similar to a credit card in real life. The development of account abstraction makes it easier to turn this vision into reality.

Showcase the power of account abstraction wallet and Huma Protocol by having a credit line for every wallet. It is critical for successful projects to demonstrate mechanisms that will ensure seamless payback of the debt, and drive accountability. You can use mechanisms like social vouching or staking, DIDs and on-chain reputation systems, shared custody of assets, and any other wild ideas you may have.

WE COMMIT TO PROVIDE THE BEST DEVELOPER SUPPORT! 

-   Open sourced smart contract wallets to consider

[soulwallet](https://github.com/proofofsoulprotocol/soul-wallet-contract),

[argent](https://github.com/argentlabs/argent-contracts),

[eth-infinitism](https://github.com/eth-infinitism/account-abstraction/tree/develop/contracts),

[stackup](https://github.com/stackup-wallet/stackup/tree/main/apps/contracts), [bcnmy](https://github.com/bcnmy/scw-contracts),

[dharma](https://github.com/dharma-eng/dharma-smart-wallet),

etc
challenges.acceptanceCriteria:
-   WOW effect and creativity matter the most
-   Prototype that works (credit line for each wallet, sound mechanism to minimize default)
-   Use Huma protocol (lending contracts, DSP, EA)
-   [Bonus] Build with account abstraction wallet
-   [Bonus] The solution is implemented with a privacy-preserving design

challenges.name: Launch a real-world lending use case on Huma
challenges.description:
Huma Protocol is designed in such a way that real-world lending fintech can launch their business on Huma, operating as a pool owner. This bounty is designed for projects to showcase this capability. A typical demo should include: 

1.  Selection of the right pool type (CreditLinePool vs. ReceivableFactoringPool)
2.  Deployment and configuration of the lending pool and FeeManager to support the use case
3.  A simple underwriting decision engine (Huma Evaluation Agent framework preferred, not required)
4.  A dApp that showcases the user interactions

If the winning project team decides to launch this lending business and leverage DeFi, Huma will help the team source initial liquidity for their pool.

WE COMMIT TO PROVIDE THE BEST DEVELOPER SUPPORT!
challenges.acceptanceCriteria:
-   Prototype that demonstrates the end-to-end flow. 
-   Use Huma protocol

We reserve the right to withhold in cases where low-quality submissions do not meet our bounty requirements.

challenges.description: You don‚Äôt write code? No worries, you can still participate in the bounty and contribute to HUMAnity (Huma community) by writing or creating educational and meaningful content pieces like blogs or videos.

challenges.name: Nuvo
challenges.description:
Nuvo is a decentralized Web2 and Web3 application credentialing system. It provides an open engagement & reputation framework while preserving user data privacy and ownership. Application developers gain robust engagement and retention capabilities while reducing the cost and liability associated with storing user data. Users may optionally share their application usage data with marketers and other applications for token incentives.

We‚Äôre looking for innovative projects, tools, and features incorporating NuvoPower or ‚ÄúNP‚Äù (previously Matrix Reputation Power system). 

Tools and dApps can use NP to build community, reward contributors, recognize achievements, establish identity, and more. We‚Äôre especially interested in use cases of NP representing an identity layer in your project (on-chain credentials) for dApps, web3 applications, and community contribution or engagement.

We are also especially interested in projects bridging the gap between web2 and web3, data ownership, and blockchain abstraction to the end user.

Nuvo bounty winners will be eligible to claim VIP Developer badge when it‚Äôs available:

1st: Nuvo VIP Developer Level 1 Badge (worth $5,000+ )

2nd: Nuvo VIP Developer Level 1 Badge (worth $5,000+ )

3rd: Nuvo VIP Developer Level 1 Badge (worth $5,000+ )
challenges.acceptanceCriteria:

  • Pitch deck or problem statement solving issues in one or more of the following:

    • Data ownership

    • Community engagement or development

    • Customer loyalty or exclusivity

    • Training and education

    • Digital identity

  • Demonstration of NuvoPower used

  • Roadmap of how NuvoPower will be used

Developer should be on our Discord (https://discord.gg/3jnuatySTt) and follow Twitter (@nuvosphere)

challenges.name: Best Use of Fuel Predicates
challenges.description: Fuel has native account abstraction through predicates. A predicate is just a condition under which you can spend a UTXO. Predicates are scripts where the main function returns a boolean. A pure function where assets under that predicate are unlocked and can be spent by the caller if evaluated to true. A predicate owns or controls UTXOs, and with predicates you can build things like native multi sigs, atomic swaps, and more.
challenges.acceptanceCriteria:
1. Technical Implementation: Technical implementation and quality of contract deployed on testnet Weight = 3

  2. Design: Quality of the UI/UX of the Fuel dapp and Sway smart contract Weight = 2

  3. Creativity: The submission should be built with creativity in mind to reflect the team‚Äôs passion for building with Sway Weight = 2

  4. Quality of Idea: Quality of the idea/use-case/problem statement. A unique project stands a higher chance to win than one that has been implemented before Weight = 2

  5. Developer Feedback: Quality and quantity of feedback and questions on the experience of building with Fuel in the developer forum (https://forum.fuel.network/) Weight = 1

challenges.name: Build a Liquid Staking Pool
challenges.description: Develop a liquid staking pool on SSV with the core functionality of being able to stake any amount of ETH and a staking derivative token.
challenges.acceptanceCriteria:
This bounty is aimed for early stage startups - if you are a new team, this bounty is also offered for MVP on testnet as requirements.

  • Judging will lean towards projects that are full MVPs, with the core requirements of handling user ETH deposits and redemptions, aggregation of user funds into 32 ETH validators which are activated on the Beacon Chain (Ethereum Deposit Contract) and managed by the ssv network (Register validator on SSV Network Smart Contract), while maintaining all required operational costs (SSV payments).

  • Working UI to enable users to deposit, redeem and keep track of their staked amount & rewards.

  • Bonus points: supporting dynamic operator selection (curated / permissioned-less).

  • Liquid staking pool with LSD token

    Oracle integration for LSD rebasing and presentation of user's staking rewards.

Promising and well executing teams will be evaluated for additional funding as candidates in our grants program and ecosystem fund programs. Details could be found at: https://ssv.network/get-funded/

Please note that we reserve the right to withhold prizing in cases where low-quality submissions do not meet our bounty requirements.

Out of eligible submissions, 3 winners will be rewarded: 1st - $5K, 2nd - $4K, 3rd - $3K

This bounty is co-sponsored with Chainlink - an extra $1K (LINK) will be awarded to the best team who utilized Chainlink‚Äôs PoR as part of this bounty.
